paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for KCNH2, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: We focused our studies on three patient LQTS2 nonsense variants in the hERG C terminus: Q702TAG, R863TGA, and W1001TGA.

functional_data.summary: The Q702X mutation leads to a truncated protein that does not exhibit potassium currents.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the patient.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is one of the most common mutations associated with LQTS2.
key_quotes: Q702X mutants are expressed with mCherry fluorescence and are not fully translated, thus missing YFP fluorescence.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: R863X mutant also shows an abolishment of YFP expression with a slight decrease in hERG trafficking.

functional_data.summary: The R863X mutation leads to a significant reduction in potassium currents.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the patient.
variants.additional_notes: This variant is associated with a dominant-negative effect on hERG function.
key_quotes: Co-expressing ArgUGA tRNA rescues YFP expression and hERG trafficking.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: W1001X mutant shows loss of YFP with similar hERG trafficking.

functional_data.summary: The W1001X mutation leads to a loss of function in hERG channels.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in the patient.
variants.additional_notes: This variant shows less efficient rescue compared to other tRNAs.
key_quotes: Co-expressing TrpUGA with hERG[W1001X] yielded a relatively poor recovery of YFP fluorescence.

extraction_metadata.notes: All variants extracted were from the KCNH2 gene.
